title: Social Learning Simulation for Sustainable Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and understanding of social interaction principles
context.additional_context: A process for high school students preparing for professional careers in medical, legal, or technical fields to practice sustainability thinking in complex, realistic social scenarios. Through VR/simulation, they experience diverse perspectives and develop collaborative problem-solving skills via reflective practice.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze sustainability-related social conflicts in a VR simulation environment and compare at least three perspectives.
Learners can evaluate their decision-making processes and propose improvement strategies using the Reflexive Praxis framework.
Learners can design sustainability strategies reflecting ethical considerations in large-scale collaborative projects and quantitatively/qualitatively assess implementation results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
